results.title: A Fire called Jeremiah
results.creator_credit: James Algar and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Shows modern technical methods of fire-fighting used by the United States Forest Service to prevent forest fires from approaching gigantic proportions and destroying hundreds of human lives.

results.title: A Field in Asia
results.creator_credit: George Wickremesinghe, Jehangir Bhownagary, Ceylon Government Film Unit and United Nations
results.brief_description: Agricultural extension officers of F.A.O. encourage Asian farmers to use better methods to increase harvests. An example in Ceylon shows use of better seed and improved sowing, cultivating and fertilising. Original music by Ravi Shankar.

results.title: A Few things I know about her
results.brief_description: Six short films which look at issues of femininity, body image, gender roles and which celebrate aspects of being a woman. A fascinating insight into what makes women tick.

results.title: A Faroe Islands family
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Nordisk Films Kompagni
results.brief_description: Illustrates the geographical features of the Faroe Islands, showing how they affect the lives of the inhabitants, making farming difficult. Highland pastures afford grazing for large flocks of sheep and a few horses and cows. The wool is plucked by hand and carded, spun and woven in the farm houses. Extensive fishing operations are a mainstay of the economy of the islands.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Nordisk Films Kompagni

results.title: A Farmer's boy
results.brief_description: Film about a farmer’s son who is about to start working on his father’s farm. The boy’s parents suggest that he goes to agricultural college. Shows the work of Seale-Hayne Agricultural College, Devon including students pig feeding, milking, butter making, poultry rearing, ploughing, machine maintenance and sheep shearing.
results.description: Film about a farmer’s son who is about to start working on his father’s farm. The boy’s parents suggest that he goes to agricultural college. results.title: A Far off world
results.brief_description: A love story set on another planet. A girl finds herself in doubt about a relationship with her friend. She seeks advice from the Master of the Planet. He grants her wish but she finds later that it is not quite what she had in mind.

results.title: A Family group
results.creator_credit: Ivor Wood, Michael Bond and FilmFair
results.brief_description:
Animated children’s story about Paddington Bear and his adventures. In this chapter Paddington goes out and buys a camera so that he can take a photograph of the family.
Adapted from Chapter 1 from the book: More about paddington. Narrated by Michael Hordern.

results.title: A Family affair
results.creator_credit: Margaret Thomson, Helen De Mourpied and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: A plea for foster-parents to take in orphaned, neglected or deserted children. Shows conditions in a special home; points out some of the personal difficulties faced by such children; maintains that only a place in a real family will allow these children a full and free life; examples of a husband and wife who took in six children of various ages at the one time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Margaret Thomson, Helen De Mourpied and Crown Film Unit

results.title: A Fair go in life
results.brief_description: Looks at the operation of the Supplementary Grants Program at Springvale Primary School, a disadvantage school. Notes in particular the process involved in opening the lines of communication between the school and the community.
